required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Sectional Matrix Versus Circumferential Matrix for Reproduction of Proximal Contact
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Sectional Matrix Versus Circumferential Matrix for Reproduction of Proximal Contact by Undergraduate Students and Postgraduate Dentists: Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the effects of different matricing techniques either sectional matrix or circumferential matrix on reproduction of optimum proximal contacts and contours during restoration of class II cavities with resin composite by undergraduate students or postgraduate dentists.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 hours from randomization till contact is restored
primary_outcome.description: Reproduction of proximal contact either optimum, tight or loose (Categorical)

arm_group.description: Circumferential matrix band applied by tofflemire retainer

intervention.intervention_name: MD ring and precontoured sectional matrix by TOR VM
intervention.description: MD ring (separation ring) and precontoured sectional matrix (thickness 0.035mm hard) and a wedge was used to secure matrix in place

intervention.intervention_name: Circumferential matrix and tofflemire retainer by Kerr
intervention.description: Circumferential matrix (thickness 0.038mm) applied by tofflemire retainer and secured in place with wedge

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Compound class II cavities
- Good oral hygiene
- No spacing or crowding
- Healthy peridontium
Exclusion Criteria:
- Complex class II cavities
- Poor oral hygiene
- Spacing or crowding
- Evidence of peridontal disease

responsible_party.investigator_title: Lecturer of conservative dentistry, Faculty of Dentistry
